title: President's Park (White House): Park Home
body: The President of the United States lives in a National Park  Every president except George Washington has called the White House and its surrounding grounds his place of work, rest, and solitude. Recognizable around the world, the White House stands as a symbol of democracy. The White House and its park grounds serve not only as the seat of the executive branch of government of the United States of America, but also as an iconic place for civil discourse.                How to Tour the White House   Tours must be scheduled through your Congressman or embassy.        White House Visitor Center   Exhibits and artifacts tell the story of the White House as a symbol, stage, and home.
